section.name: Host Management
section.p: Transit uses artifact uris to identify a resource. These identifiers are in turn mapped internally to a repository url (i.e. mapping identity to a location). Locations are defined relative to one or more hosts.

Each Transit host declares a base url, an implementation strategy (typically dealing with uri to url mapping), and policies concerning the handling of timestamped resources. The Transit hosts configuration enables the declaration of local file based repositories and remote repositories accessible via http and https protocols. Host configurations may also be declared using properties. In both cases the source of the authorative configuration may be managed locally or centralized under a remote location.
Example of artifact retrival and remote repositories are included in the Transit Guide.
